meanings.definition: To thrust or throw forcefully into a substance or place.
meanings.sent1: She was plunging the spoon into the cake batter.
meanings.sent2: The diver was plunging into the deep blue sea.
meanings.sent3: The chef was plunging the vegetables into the boiling water with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The knight plunged his sword into the dragon's heart.
meanings.sent5: The waterfall was plunging down the rocky cliff with great force.

meanings.definition: To fall or drop suddenly and uncontrollably.
meanings.sent1: The bird was plunging from the sky towards its nest.
meanings.sent2: The rock climber was plunging down the steep cliff.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was plunging from branch to branch in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: The elevator was plunging rapidly to the ground floor.
meanings.sent5: The snowball was plunging down the hill, gaining speed.

meanings.definition: A sudden or dramatic decrease in value or amount.
meanings.sent1: The stock market experienced a plunging in prices.
meanings.sent2: The plunging of the currency caused chaos in the economy.
meanings.sent3: The sudden plunging of the temperature caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent4: The plunging of attendance at the event was concerning.
meanings.sent5: The plunging of the waterfall created a beautiful mist in the air.
